title: Western Canada's Alberta calls for help to fight early-season wildfires
description: Some 30,000 people are currently under evacuation orders as the province continues to deal with out-of-control blazes.

title: 'Succession' season 4: I love you, I love you not
description: 'Succession' final season (7/10). Every week, Le Monde reviews the trials and tribulations of the Roy family and its media empire.

title: Governance goes global in France's blue-chip CAC 40 index
description: The new head of the French company Schneider Electric is German. In the CAC 40 stock index, which gathers France's cherished flagship corporations, 13 companies now have a chair or chief executive who has foreign passport.

title: Public Accounts Minister Attal: 'All tax fraud is serious, but that by the most powerful is unforgivable'
description: Gabriel Attal presents the French government's new plans for cracking down on tax evasion, with measures including increasingly frequent audits for multinationals and the creation of a fiscal intelligence service.

title: Do students still believe in the European dream?
description: Studying, living and working in a European Union country is the plan for a growing number of French students, who also aspire to a different Europe. Testimonies.

title: Germany introduces 'Asparagus Day' in bid to save national emblem
description: Consumption habits are changing in Germany, causing concern within the asparagus industry.

title: War in Ukraine: Away from frontlines, country's future rests with closely-watched reforms
description: The European Union is scrutinizing Ukraine's progress toward the requirements for its admission into the bloc. Civil society is actively taking part.

title: 'European governments must guarantee a humanitarian zone in the Mediterranean'
description: On the occasion of Europe Day on May 9, 100 elected officials call for EU countries to respect the rules that apply to rescue at sea and to put an end to sanctions against humanitarian organizations.

title: Ligue 1: 'The Lens model should inspire French clubs, especially those with greater means'
description: Franck Haise's RC Lens ranks 2nd in Ligue 1 after its victory against Marseille this weekend. It is showing the way for other clubs that have more money.

title: Chinese foreign minister to visit Germany, France, Norway
description: One of the key topics during Qin Gang's visit will be the war in Ukraine, with European countries pushing China to put pressure on Russia.

title: Uzbek leader calls early election after referendum
description: The presidential election, which will take place in July, comes after constitutional changes allowing President Shavkat Mirziyoyev to serve for two more terms.

title: Mali's UN peacekeepers fear they are becoming 'an instrument of the junta'
description: The MINUSMA peacekeeping mission is struggling to carry out its duties on the ground. The work of the UN representative in Bamako is also internally criticized, with some seeing him as too conciliatory with the junta led by Colonel Assimi Goïta.

title: EU targets evasion in new round of Russia sanctions
description: EU ambassadors are to meet on Wednesday to begin discussions on the latest proposals.

title: Macron condemns vandalism of explicit painting at Paris museum
description: The painting by Swiss artist Miriam Cahn, entitled "Fuck abstraction!", was covered in purple spray paint on Sunday at the Palais de Tokyo.

title: EU's von der Leyen to visit Kyiv on Tuesday
description: The trip will mark the fifth time von der Leyen has visited the Ukrainian capital since Russia's all-out invasion of the country in February last year.

title: Macron to make state visit to Germany in July
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will visit the country in July, amid friction on nuclear power and defense acquisition programs.

title: Russia: Forest fires break out in Siberia amid heatwave
description: At least one person died as three Russian regions were hit by dozens of forest fires.

title: Chile's far right prevails in Constitutional Council election
description: The Republican Party emerged as the leading political force in the election on Sunday, May 7. But the far right has always been opposed to writing a new constitution.

title: The first time Le Monde wrote 'Fox News'
description: The 24-hour news channel is in the news after its star presenter Tucker Carlson was fired. Fox News Channel, founded by the billionaire Rupert Murdoch, was first mentioned by Le Monde on October 6, 1996.

title: Ukraine: Zelensky announces plan to move Victory Day commemorations to May 8
description: Ukraine historically celebrated the victory in World War II on May 9, like Russia. But President Volodymyr Zelensky submitted a bill to change the date to May 8, matching most of Europe.

title: Toronto, renowned for economic and cultural wealth, grapples with mental health crisis
description: Canada's center for international business and arts is facing a serious mental health crisis caused by social inequality and failing health facilities.

title: Paris: Centre Pompidou looks for venues and funding ahead of 5-year closure
description: With the Centre Pompidou closed for renovation from 2025 to 2030, it is looking to redeploy some of its collections and staff to other institutions in Paris and beyond.

title: E-sports: 'CS: GO' Major Championship in Paris symbolizes recent political craze
description: The prestigious 'Counter-Strike' championship, to be held in France for the first time from May 8 to 21, symbolizes French President Emmanuel Macron's newfound interest in the sector of competitive video gaming.

title: Turkey: One week before elections, Erdogan defends record and attacks challengers
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan delivered a bellicose speech on Sunday in Istanbul, defending his record and attacking the opposition.

title: Aulas leaves Olympique Lyonnais, after 36-year reign that changed the club's destiny
description: Lyon's football club announced Monday that Jean-Michel Aulas, who sold OL to new American owners in December 2022, would be stepping down from his role as president.

title: Nigeria tries to deal with exodus of doctors to the West
description: A draft law to keep young practitioners in the country for at least five years has provoked an uproar in a profession marred by deep malaise.

title: The making of Ukraine's heroes
description: To cultivate the image of a country united in the face of the Russian invasion, Ukraine rewards acts of bravery with medals for soldiers and civilians. But the handing out of these distinctions sometimes causes resentment.

title: Conservatives ahead in key vote for new Chile constitution
description: It was a major defeat for Chile's center-left president, Gabriel Boric, with the vote also widely viewed as a referendum on his government, which currently has an approval rating of around 30%.

title: Sweden's far right is hoping to do a 'clean sweep' across institutions
description: After years in opposition, the far-right Sweden Democrats have become an auxiliary force for the coalition government and intend to exert their influence on appointments.

title: How I got into an argument: 'My sister made fun of my daughter for her wedding, and I lost it'
description: A love or friendship quarrel, a family rift, or a professional disagreement have left lasting impressions on their lives. They recount their experiences to Le Monde. This week, we hear from Agnès, a 60-year-old retiree.

title: CMA CGM's unstoppable rise in transport and logistics
description: The world's third largest container shipping company, headed by Rodolphe Saadé, is in exclusive negotiations to buy Bolloré's logistics business for €5 billion.

title: Morocco: two years after the cannabis law, farmers in the Rif still 'in the dark'
description: Kif producers are encouraged to abandon the illegal market and sell their crop for medical and industrial purposes, but few dare to take the plunge.
